But it does make the issue kind of complex to deal with, which is why it was abstracted out to a separate issue from a parent issue.
I think it is probably best not to delve into such complexity at this time for a small change, so the current solution you have presented works great. Looks good to me. Thank you for contributing!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8504
activity.text:
@nihal467 
- because you did not like the left-right scroll, I changed it to go the next row. Let me know if it doesn't look good.
- changed "a" to "am/pm"
- fixed the edge case of the overflow. Also verified all the inputs again. Please let me know if I missed out on something.

cc. @gigincg

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8535
activity.text: Sidebar bug on resize

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8504
activity.text:
@nihal467 

1. Will see to the scroll issue. Wasn't happening with my screen size
2. I did not keep the auto closing thing because : It will close if a user will set the time before setting the date or vice-versa which adds makes it a UX issue.
3. "a" means AM/PM. If it is not understandable I will change it to "am/pm"
> We had an existing behavior where typing "12092024" would automatically format the input as 12/09/2024
4. The existing behaviour made it easy to enter the date, but totally hard to update it. The reason it was removed was so that the user does not face this while editing the date:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7313c037-a439-4662-9cf0-5c038ecc50a4

Because this behaviour was changed, the tests were also changed.

5. The input will auto reset if the entered time is not of the desired format.
6. On mobile devices, the component can be scrolled left-right. This is because the date input would become small if i try to change sizes/ do anything else.
7. You did not add space, which made it an invalid format.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/ayushma_fe#200
activity.text:
@samholics 

1 - Issue with recaptcha has been solved.
2 - Issue with empty audio is due to whisper hallucinating. Although model hallucinations are hard to prevent, I will cover it up in https://github.com/ohcnetwork/ayushma/issues/521
3 - If the response was correct the first 2 times, an error on the third time would be due to hallucinations in the model. This should be a rare occurrence. If this happens often, we can cover it up later on.
4 - The audio highlights don't match currently. I will check and verify if it is possible to match them.
5 - Likely due to server load at OpenAI's end. I will investigate
6 - What do you suggest for making it more evident?

@gigincg I think we can merge to production as none of the pointed out issues pertain to the vector db change. They can be taken up later.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7860
activity.text:
@gayann-au some doubts with the new skills

Is `Family Medicine Physician` and `Family Physician` the same skills?

And do we wish to rename the following?
Intensivist -> Intensivist/Critical Care Physician
Obstetrician and Gynecologist -> Obstetrician/Gynecologist (OB/GYN)

We already have `Thoraco-Vascular Surgeon`. Do we need to separate it into `Thoracic Surgeon` and `Vascular Surgeon` or treat them as new skills?

From the list you shared, I came up with the following new skills to be added

- Allergist/Immunologist
- Cardiothoracic Surgeon
- Gynecologic Oncologist
- Hepatologist
- Internist
- Neonatologist
- Pain Management Specialist
- Physiatrist (Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation)
- Podiatrist
- Preventive Medicine Specialist
- Radiation Oncologist
- Sleep Medicine Specialist
- Thoracic Surgeon
- Transplant Surgeon
- Trauma Surgeon
- Vascular Surgeon

Hope I didn't miss out something.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/ayushma_fe#191
activity.text:
@vishisht-dubey Our implementation of dark mode is different. We don't use the `dark:` class because it results in a lot of manual class rewrites. 
Rather, we use relative class names that produce different results for each mode.

> for example, bg-primary substitutes to bg-white in white mode and bg-black in dark mode.
> 
> A list of all the relative colors are present in [constants](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/ayushma_fe/blob/master/src/utils/constants.ts).

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#5140
activity.text:
Just to quantify the impact of this PR, starting the current *CRA app takes 1 minute and 36 seconds* on my laptop with 16 gb ram and an i5-11400H @ 2.70GHz  2.69 GHz CP.
The *Vite app takes just 40 seconds to start* which makes the app start *215%* faster than before. App hot reload also take considerably less time than before. This allows CARE to be developed in less powerful computers. Great feat @sainak

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#2376
activity.text:
> @skks1212 This behaviour preserves the page that the user is at when they log back in. If we solve this, we might have to preserve the previous page (Maybe in localstorage/sessionstorage) in order to redirect them back to the page.

I think the best preservation technique would be to have a ?ref query param in the url containing the url of the page to redirect to after logging in. I have seen many websites do this.
